title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Treatment Guidelines
content: Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune inflammatory condition affecting multiple joints symmetrically. Early intervention with disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs) is crucial to prevent joint destruction. Treatment typically involves methotrexate as first-line therapy, potentially combined with biologic agents for refractory cases. Regular monitoring of disease activity and adjustment of therapy is essential for optimal outcomes.
